questions.question_text:
An administrator enables DRS and sets the automation level to Fully Automated. DRS is only making initial placement recommendations.
What is causing this?

discussion.content:
I am only sure that most of the answers for this exam are wrong on this website you need to make sure guys about every question

and my vote for C
I think: DRS is set to aggressive

choices.B: HA is disabled on the cluster.
choices.D: The VMs have virtual flash reservations.

questions.question_text:
A vSphere administrator has configured software iSCSI port binding in the environment with two VMkernel ports and four target portals.
How many iSCSI sessions would be created from bound ports to targets?

discussion.content:
Answer is C: 8

VMkernel Ports - 2 bound VMkernel ports
Target Portals - 4 target portals
iSCSI Sessions - 8 sessions (2 x 4)

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.html.hostclient.doc/GUID-4C19E34E-764C-4069-9D9F-D0F779F2A96C.html

choices.C: Enable Storage I/O Control on the datastore containing APPVM01 and DBVM01.
choices.B: Enable Storage I/O Control on the cluster containing APPVM01 and DBVM01.
choices.E: Configure APPVM01 with a shares limit of High, and DBVM01 with a shares limit of Normal.
choices.A: Enable Network I/O Control on the cluster containing APPVM01 and DBVM01.
choices.D: Configure APPVM01 with a shares limit of Low, and DBVM01 with a shares limit of Normal.

questions.question_text:
An appliance owner complains about poor performance on a VM named APPVM01. Troubleshooting indicates that another VM named DBVM01 on the same datastore is saturating the volume with I/O requests.
Which two actions can be taken to reduce DBVM01 impact on APPVM01, while still prioritizing DBVM01 disk I/O? (Choose two.)

choices.D: User A can take a snapshot on AX-1000.
choices.A: User B can delete from disk XRK-01.
choices.E: User C can view configuration of AX-1000.
choices.B: User A can take a snapshot on XRK-01.
choices.C: User C can convert AX-850 to VM.

discussion.content:
The Members of Group2 are wrong. Should be: UserA, User C
Given the corrected Group2, answers B and D are correct.

A. User B can delete from disk XRK-01. - No. User B has Read-Only permissions.
B. User A can take a snapshot on XRK-01. - No. User A has Read-Only permissions.
C. User C can convert AX-850 to VM. - No. There is no user C.
D. User A can take a snapshot on AX-1000. - Yes. User A has Administrator permissions.
E. User C can view configuration of AX-1000. - No. There is no user C.

If you add user C to Group2 the answer to statement C and E will still be no.
If you add user C to Group1 the answer to statement C and E will be yes.

So not sure how to get 2 answers correct from this question.
There is something wrong with users and groups
D is the only good answer
Image from this question is wrong. It should shows user C in group 2.

questions.question_text:
An administrator manages a cluster containing Production and Test VMs. Production VMs run on a VSS port group and a storage array separate from the Test
VMs. The administrator wants to prevent large (>500GB) file transfers in Test from impacting Production.
Which two configuration changes should the administrator make to achieve this? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Install a second virtual NIC in the Production VMs.
choices.B: Enable NIOC on the virtual switch.
choices.D: Move the Test VMs to a dedicated folder with CPU shares set to low.
choices.E: Move the Production VMs to a resource pool with a memory reservation.
choices.A: Migrate the VSS port groups to VDS port groups.

discussion.content: I will support A and B as well.

I believe this one would be A & B.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/com.vmware.vsphere.networking.doc/GUID-ADEA0213-C969-43E4-B1F4-66D4A916EBDF.html
